test-set.name: prod-MapTest
test-set.description: Tests for the MapTest production: map types in XPath 3.1

test-case.name: MapTest-001
test-case.test: map{} instance of map(*)

test-case.name: MapTest-002
test-case.test: map{1:"London"} instance of map(*)

test-case.name: MapTest-003
test-case.test: map{1:"London", "London":1} instance of map(*)

test-case.name: MapTest-004
test-case.test: map{} instance of map(xs:integer, xs:string)

test-case.name: MapTest-005
test-case.test: map{1:"London"} instance of map(xs:integer, xs:string)

test-case.name: MapTest-006
test-case.test: map{1:"London", "London":1} instance of map(xs:integer, xs:string)

test-case.name: MapTest-007
test-case.test: map{1:"London"} instance of map(xs:integer)

test-case.name: MapTest-008
test-case.test: map{1:"London"} instance of map(integer, string)

test-case.name: MapTest-009
test-case.description: instance of map type after remove
test-case.test: map:remove(map{1:"London", "London":1}, "London") instance of map(xs:integer, xs:string)

test-case.name: MapTest-010
test-case.description: instance of map type after addition
test-case.test: map:put(map{1:"London", 2:"Paris"}, 3, current-date()) instance of map(xs:integer, xs:string)

test-case.name: MapTest-011
test-case.description: instance of a less specific map type
test-case.test: map:put(map{1:"London", 2:"Paris"}, 3, "Berlin") instance of map(xs:decimal, xs:string+)

test-case.name: MapTest-012
test-case.test: map{"London":(), "Paris":(), "Berlin":()} instance of map(xs:string, empty-sequence())

test-case.name: MapTest-013
test-case.test: map{"London":(), "Paris":(), "Berlin":(), "Rome":5} instance of map(xs:string, empty-sequence())

test-case.name: MapTest-014
test-case.test: map{"London":1, "Paris":2, "Berlin":3, "Rome":()} instance of map(xs:string, xs:integer?)

test-case.name: MapTest-015
test-case.test: map{"London":1, "Paris":2, "Berlin":3, "Rome":()} instance of map(xs:string, xs:integer+)

test-case.name: MapTest-016
test-case.description: key type must be an item type
test-case.test: map{"London":1, "Paris":2, "Berlin":3, "Rome":5} instance of map(xs:string+, xs:integer+)

test-case.name: MapTest-017
test-case.test: map{"London":1, "Paris":2, "Berlin":3, "Rome":5} instance of map(xs:string, xs:integer+)*

test-case.name: MapTest-018
test-case.test: (map{"London":1, "Paris":2, "Berlin":3, "Rome":5}, map{}) instance of map(xs:string, xs:integer+)*

test-case.name: MapTest-019
test-case.test: (map{"London":1, "Paris":2, "Berlin":3, "Rome":5}, map{}) instance of map(xs:string, xs:integer+)?

test-case.name: MapTest-020
MapTest-021
test-case.description: conversion on function call occurs in 4.0

test-case.name: MapTest-040
test-case.test: function($m as map(xs:integer, xs:string)) as xs:integer {map:size($m)} instance of function(map(*)) as xs:integer

test-case.name: MapTest-041
test-case.test: function($m as map(xs:integer, xs:string)) as xs:integer {map:size($m)} instance of function(map(xs:decimal, xs:string+)) as xs:integer

test-case.name: MapTest-042
test-case.test: function($m as map(*)) as xs:integer {map:size($m)} instance of function(function(*)) as xs:integer

test-case.name: MapTest-043
test-case.test: function($m as map(xs:integer, xs:string)) as xs:integer {map:size($m)} instance of function(function(*)) as xs:integer

test-case.name: MapTest-044
test-case.test: function($m as map(xs:integer, xs:string)) as xs:integer {map:size($m)} instance of function(function(xs:anyAtomicType) as item()*) as xs:integer

test-case.name: MapTest-045
test-case.test: function($m as map(xs:integer, xs:string)) as xs:integer {map:size($m)} instance of function(function(xs:integer) as item()*) as xs:integer

test-case.name: MapTest-046
test-case.test: map{} instance of map(xs:integer, map(xs:integer, xs:string))

test-case.name: MapTest-047
test-case.description: empty map type (assumes dynamic type checking)

modified.change: Use valid XPath syntax for let expression

test-case.name: MapTest-048
test-case.test: let $f := function($m as map(xs:integer, xs:string)) as xs:integer {map:size($m)} return $f(map{})

test-case.name: MapTest-049
MapTest-050
test-case.test: function($m as map(*)) as xs:integer {map:size($m)} instance of function(map(xs:integer, xs:string)) as xs:integer

test-case.name: MapTest-051
test-case.test: function($m as map(xs:decimal, xs:string+)) as xs:integer {map:size($m)} instance of function(map(xs:integer, xs:string)) as xs:integer

test-case.name: MapTest-052
test-case.test: function($m as function(*)) as xs:integer {function-arity($m)} instance of function(map(*)) as xs:integer

test-case.name: MapTest-053
test-case.test: function($m as function(*)) as xs:integer {function-arity($m)} instance of function(map(xs:integer, xs:string)) as xs:integer

test-case.name: MapTest-054
test-case.test: function($m as function(xs:anyAtomicType) as item()*) as xs:integer {map:size($m)} instance of function(map(xs:integer, xs:string)) as xs:integer

test-case.name: MapTest-055
test-case.description: Dynamic function call with operand a map

test-case.name: MapTest-057
test-case.description: Dynamic function call with operand a map
test-case.test: let $map:= map{1:'a', 2:'b', 3:'c', 4:'d'} return $map(3)

test-case.name: MapTest-058
test-case.description: Map as a function of xs:anyAtomicType

modified.change: Change expected result. See qt4tests issue 109.

test-case.test: let $s as function(xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:string? := map { 1:'A','x':'B' } return $s?*

test-case.name: MapTest-058a
test-case.description: Map as a function of xs:anyAtomicType. A coerced function is not a map.

modified.change: Change expected result. See qt4tests issue 109.

test-case.test: let $s as function(xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:string? := map { 1:'A','x':'B' } return $s?*

test-case.name: MapTest-059
test-case.description: Map as a function, invoking transitivity (see https://github.com/w3c/qt3tests/issues/28)
test-case.test: map { 1:'A','x':'B' } instance of function(xs:integer) as xs:string?

test-case.name: MapTest-060
test-case.description: Map as a function, invoking transitivity (see https://github.com/w3c/qt3tests/issues/28)
test-case.test: map { 1:'A','x':'B' } instance of function(xs:integer) as item()*

test-case.name: MapTest-061
test-case.description: Map as a function, invoking transitivity (see https://github.com/w3c/qt3tests/issues/28)
test-case.test: map { 1:'A','x':'B' } instance of function(xs:integer) as xs:string

test-case.name: MapTest-062
test-case.description: Map as a function, invoking transitivity (see https://github.com/w3c/qt3tests/issues/28)
test-case.test: map { 1:'A','x':'B' } instance of function(xs:integer) as item()+

test-case.name: MapTest-063
test-case.description: Map as a function, invoking transitivity (see https://github.com/w3c/qt3tests/issues/28)
test-case.test: map {} instance of function(xs:integer) as empty-sequence()

test-case.name: MapTest-064
test-case.description: Map as a function, invoking transitivity (see https://github.com/w3c/qt3tests/issues/28)
test-case.test: map {12: ()} instance of function(xs:decimal) as empty-sequence()

test-case.name: MapTest-065
test-case.description: Map as a function, invoking transitivity (see https://github.com/w3c/qt3tests/issues/28)
test-case.test: map {12: ()} instance of function(xs:decimal) as xs:string*

test-case.name: MapTest-066
test-case.description: Map as a function, invoking transitivity (see https://github.com/w3c/qt3tests/issues/28)
test-case.test: map {12: "z"} instance of function(xs:decimal) as xs:string

test-case.name: MapTest-067
test-case.description: Map key can be a built-in union type
test-case.test: map {12: "z"} instance of map(xs:numeric, xs:string)

test-case.name: MapTest-068
test-case.description: Map key can be a built-in union type
test-case.test: map {'abc': "z"} instance of map(xs:numeric, xs:string)

test-case.name: MapTest-069
test-case.description: Map key can be a schema-defined union type

schema.description: A schema defining a motley collection of union types.

test-case.test: import schema namespace u="http://www.w3.org/XQueryTest/unionListDefined"; map {current-date(): "z"} instance of map(u:approximateDate, xs:string)

test-case.name: MapTest-070
test-case.description: Map key cannot be an impure union type

schema.description: A schema defining a motley collection of union types.

test-case.test: import schema namespace u="http://www.w3.org/XQueryTest/unionListDefined"; map {current-date(): "z"} instance of map(u:impureUnionType, xs:string)

test-case.name: MapTest-071
test-case.description: Map as a function: once coerced, it is no longer a map
test-case.test: let $f as function(xs:integer) as xs:string := map { 1:'A','x':'B' } return $f instance of map(*)

test-case.name: MapTest-072
test-case.description: Coercion applied to a map returned from a function

test-case.name: MapTest-073
test-case.description: Treat a map as a function
test-case.test: let $s := map { 1: 'A', 'x': 'B' } treat as function(xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:string? return $s?*

test-case.name: MapTest-080
test-case.test: let $m as map(xs:integer, xs:byte*) := { 1: (1, 2) } return $m instance of map(xs:integer, xs:byte*)

test-case.name: MapTest-081
test-case.test: let $m as map(xs:integer, xs:byte*) := { 1: (1.2, 2) } return $m

test-case.name: MapTest-082
test-case.test: let $m as map(xs:integer, xs:byte?) := { 1: (1, 2) } return $m

test-case.name: MapTest-083
test-case.test: let $m as map(xs:integer, xs:string) := { 1: xs:anyURI('URI') } return $m?* instance of xs:string

test-case.name: MapTest-084
test-case.test: let $m as map(xs:integer, empty-sequence()) := { 1: () } return $m

test-case.name: MapTest-085
test-case.test: let $m as map(xs:integer, empty-sequence()) := { 1: 1 } return $m

test-case.name: MapTest-086
test-case.test: let $f as map(xs:byte, empty-sequence()) := { 1: () } return map:keys($f) instance of xs:byte

test-case.name: MapTest-087
test-case.test: let $f as map(xs:integer, element()) := { 1: element a {} } return local-name($f?*)

test-case.name: MapTest-088
test-case.test: let $f as map(xs:byte, xs:byte)* := ({ 1: 2 }, { 3: 4 }) return sum($f?*)

test-case.name: MapTest-089
test-case.test: let $f as map(xs:byte, xs:byte)* := ({ 1: 2 }, { 3: 456 }) return sum($f?*)

test-case.name: MapTest-090
test-case.test: let $m as map(xs:integer, xs:short*) := { 1: 0 to 0x7FFF } return sum($m?*)

test-case.name: MapTest-091
test-case.test: let $m as map(xs:integer, xs:short*) := { 1: 0 to 0x8000 } return $m

test-case.name: MapTest-092
test-case.test: let $m as map(xs:float, xs:string) := { 1.0000000000001: "one", 1.0000000000002: "two" } return $m

test-case.name: MapTest-093
test-case.description: Map incremental put with type information

test-case.name: MapTest-094
test-case.description: Map incremental map:remove with type information
